meanings.definition: Align or position towards a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: Please orient the map north before we start our journey.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to orient the furniture towards the window for better lighting.
meanings.sent3: Trying to orient a cat to walk on a leash can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts orient towards positivity, no matter the circumstances.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky can help orient you if you're lost in the wilderness.

meanings.definition: Familiarize oneself with a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: I need some time to orient myself to the new office layout.
meanings.sent2: New students often take a while to orient themselves to the school's routines.
meanings.sent3: Trying to orient to a new video game can be confusing at first.
meanings.sent4: Her mind started to orient to the idea of living in a different country.
meanings.sent5: Reading a map can help you orient to the landmarks around you.

meanings.definition: The countries of Asia, especially East Asia.
meanings.sent1: She studied the history of the orient in her World Cultures class.
meanings.sent2: Many tourists are fascinated by the culture of the orient.
meanings.sent3: The orient is known for its rich traditions and diverse cuisines.
meanings.sent4: His dream vacation destination is the exotic orient.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the orient can open your eyes to new perspectives and experiences.
